intro: Colquhounia elegans, commonly known as the silver fern, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the fern family (Polypodiaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, silver-white fronds that contrast beautifully with its deep green veins. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses. Colquhounia elegans is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining biodiversity.
